attributes.action: Prevent Freeholders from passing cladding costs to leaseholders
attributes.background: On June 14 2017, 72 people lost their lives in the Grenfell Tower fire in London.  Thousands of people are still living in tower blocks with unsafe cladding over a year later. Over 400 high-rise flats still have the same type of cladding blamed for the rapid spread of the deadly blaze.
attributes.additional_details: Leaseholders are forced to pay £millions to fix cladding and more, costs unfairly passing to us even though we were not responsible for construction or approvals. Our homes won't be made safe until funds are in place. Our flats are also unsellable and unmortgageable until works are completed, We call on parliament to make it illegal to pass on any costs related to making our homes safe, to compensate those of us who've paid for works and to require homes be made safe as soon as practicable.

attributes.action: Make late payment after agreed terms in Construction a crime & subject to a fine
attributes.background: I own a Construction Agency called Lionheart Group and I’ve been on the receiving end of bad/late payers on a number of occasions.
attributes.additional_details: It’s affecting the Construction Industry in an extremely negative way, people are losing their livelihoods through no fault of their own & we need to come together to put a stop to it once & for all!

attributes.action: Pressure Kingdom of Saudi Arabia not to execute a female civil right activist.
attributes.background: Israa Al-Ghomgham is an activist who participated in and documented the mass protests that have taken place in Qatif province in Saudi Arabia since 2011. She is currently facing the death penalty and is due to be beheaded by a public prosecutor of the KSA.
attributes.additional_details:
Saudi Arabia is taking the rare step of seeking the death penalty for a 29-year-old female activist accused of encouraging demonstrations for greater rights for the Shiite Muslim minority, the advocacy group Human Rights Watch said. 
Beheading Ms Israa Ghomgham for conducting peaceful protest is a barbaric act that violates both British and Universal values of basic human rights. We demand that the British Government put maximum pressure on the KSA to stop this barbaric act.

attributes.action: Question Cameron's decision to impose fundamental constitutional change
attributes.background: This nation is a representative democracy or at least it used to be. Then in 2016 David Cameron imposed a regime favoured by dictators and demagogues: decision by dint of a misinformed public–a referendum. An inquiry is needed to find out why he decided to impose fundamental constitutional change.
attributes.additional_details: Britain is in a political crisis brought about by the transfer of supreme authority from the electorate to the government. It is not true to say that the people decided to leave the EU, because that claim presumes that the electorate has followed the government's instruction that they must make the decision. For the government to instruct the electorate on how to vote & then instruct Parliament on how to interpret that vote is fundamentally undemocratic. Why was that instruction issued?

attributes.action: Confirmed date for National Rollout of voluntary right to buy
attributes.background: There have been numerous regional trials for the VRTB which have all been used to stall a national roll out of the scheme. Our voices are ignored, all question go unanswered. It's time we were given the same rights as council tenants as promised in the Government's 2015 manifesto.

attributes.action: Remove legal privilege from the PHSO so police can investigate misconduct
attributes.background: The Parliamentary and Health Service Ombudsman has legal privilege which means that the police cannot look at their case files to investigate allegations of staff misconduct in public office. The PHSO investigates the death of our loved ones but the police have never been able to intervene.
attributes.additional_details: The PSHO should not appear to be above the law. During the investigation into the death of my son, I believe that staff didn’t do their jobs correctly which led to a flawed report and decision. I’ll never be able to know for sure however because the police are not able to investigate. This means I will  never know the truth behind my son’s death. This is unacceptable.

attributes.action: Stop dumping of nuclear waste in the ground/off shore off Cymru
attributes.background: The Welsh Office/UK gov has failed in its duty to first consult MPs, AMs and more importantly the people of Cymru. Instead they have been 'consulting' behind closed doors. Transparency is needed not intrigue and a deadly legacy left for others.
attributes.additional_details: Cymru did not want nuclear nor does it want the waste from nuclear. An alternative answer must be found. In the meantime nuclear power stations should be closed and mothballed until science has caught up in its safe usage.

attributes.action: Make youths in further education eligible for a free bus pass
attributes.background: In England, citizens aren’t eligible for a free bus pass until they reach the state pension age. For a yearly bus pass for anybody else, it’ll cost £592, money that most teenagers and young adults don’t have. Without bus passes, many people would be unable to travel to college and university.
attributes.additional_details: There is a need for youths to have bus passes as it becomes increasingly difficult to access education as you grow older. On top of university fees, bus fees will also have to be paid. Lots of teenagers don’t have jobs or work on minimum age which can make it impossible for them to reach their college, sixth form or university. Students who have just started college (age 16) are unlikely to be eligible for a free bus pass until 2070 when they will be more than done with education.

attributes.action: To ban to use of deep confinement booths in schools.
attributes.background: Deep confinement or isolation booths are used in many Primary and Secondary Schools as part of a Behaviour Management Strategy. The use of these booths is unregulated and unreported. They are a breach of the UN charter on the rights of the child.
attributes.additional_details:
Deep confinement booths have been removed from custodial settings. Recent evidence shows that in 500 schools using isolation booths 200 children had spent more than 5 days in isolation in the past year. There is no evidence that these booths or extended isolation have any positive effect on behaviour. There is a great deal of evidence to the contrary.

We believe that the booths are full of children with SEND and will be disproportionately occupied by BAME children also. 

The campaign is not against removal or separation. Neither is it about desk dividers. We want the booths outlawed and regulation of isolation for all schools.

For more information please visit www.banthebooths.co.uk.

attributes.action: Legalise cannabis for medical and recreational use.
attributes.background:
Legalise cannabis for medical and recreational use.
It is time for the government to accept that cannabis should be legal. Prohibition has done nothing to reduce drug use and it is hypocritical for the government to allow alcohol and tobacco

attributes.action: Create new laws around letting agents to ensure students don’t get overcharged
attributes.background: Many students get overcharged when leaving their properties because it is very easy to become blinded by the confusion of the big wide world. I want laws to be changed so landlords/letting agents cannot try to charge ridiculous prices for basic things like cleaning and painting.
attributes.additional_details: I have been charged over £1000 for leaving my property after my 2nd year at University for just cleaning, gardening and painting. I have started a Facebook petition reaching out to other students and so far I have over 300 cases. I feel that it’s too easy for students to fall into these traps and accept these charges, as we do not understand the full breakdown of these costs. There needs to be a law to ban landlords and letting agents charging more than 10% mark up on services at the end of tenancies. Students are being exploited.

attributes.action: Keep Pet Passports Valid post Brexit
attributes.background: We have been advised that in the event of a No Deal Brexit pet passports between Spain and the UK will no longer be valid.  PLEASE STOP THIS.
attributes.additional_details: We have been advised that in the event of a No Deal Brexit pet passports between Spain and the UK will no longer be valid. This is likely to mean that between now and the 29th March 2019 pet transport places will fill-up very quickly. If you are living in the UK and you are thinking about adopting one of our cats, please please contact us as soon as possible, so we can ensure that they are able to get a secure and safe passage to the UK.

attributes.action: Set shorter referral times for mental health treatment on the NHS
attributes.background: Many people suffer from severe mental health illnesses. Though they might try seek help early on, the waiting time for a referral can take months. 95% of people are seen after 18 weeks but for some people that’s way too long and their lives are in danger because they can’t get help.
attributes.additional_details: The Government should set shorter targets for referral times and provide funding to ensure they are met.

attributes.action: An Opt Out system with the Bone Marrow Register and more awareness in Education.
attributes.background:
Every day at least 5 people start their search for a bone marrow donor. There are currently only 2% of people in the UK registered. This compares to 13% in Cyprus, 12% in Israel and 9% in Germany.
90% of donations take place via peripheral blood stem cell (PBSC) collection, similar to giving blood.
attributes.additional_details:
Organ donation is highlighted with public campaigns as is blood donation. Both saves lives. Bone Marrow Donation is not. It needs more public awareness, more understanding within the communities and schools. It must be made compulsory within the school age of 14-16 years. It can reduce concerns and highlight the simplicity of the procedure, which will potentially save someone's life ! 
There should be an 'Opt Out' system where those who wish to not donate can remove themselves from the register.

attributes.action: Maintain current seismic thresholds for fracking activities.
attributes.background: Fracking activity in the UK currently has to work within strict thresholds for seismic activity that may be generated by fracking operations. A relaxation could lead to more frequent seismic activity up to a level where damage to property or injury to the public is more likely to occur.

attributes.action: Increase funding to Staffordshire Police to protect villages from car crime.
attributes.background: Small villages in Staffordshire are being targeted for car crime as they are seen as easy targets due to the lack of visible police coverage. Stations are being closed and police are having to travel over an hour to reach scenes and take arrestees to stations.
attributes.additional_details: The Facebook page Wombourne Online is reporting car crime at least 4 times a week - including violent targeted thefts where homeowners are being threatened for this cars. The police are stretched to breaking point and need more resources.

attributes.action: Bring back Appeal rights & Right to work for migrants
attributes.background:
Under Immigration Act 2014, most migrants lost their right of appeal -that took their basic rights away - like Access to employment, NHS & much more. These are some of the basic needs a person requires to sustain one self. 
This has lead to many migrants living in destitute conditions.
attributes.additional_details:
In the wake of windrush incident,many of us are now awake as to what is happening in the society we live in.The whole country was left in shock. The migrants suffer everyday with these hostile policies.

We have recently seen a case of a Nigerian woman who despite facing difficulties got justice thru the courts. 

https://www.theguardian.com/uk-news/2018/aug/21/court-says-seriously-ill-woman-can-work-while-fighting-uk-deportation

Please help in bringing back basic needs for these migrants.

attributes.action: Force providers to supply the free to air tv channels on bedside tv sets.
attributes.background: Charging hospital patients who have no other means of entertainment, a fee for supplying free to air tv channels should be stopped. It is unfair to charge anyone to watch free to air channels.

attributes.action: Make it law that gluten free food in restaurants is not contaminated by gluten.
attributes.background: Food safety law in the UK is not strict enough around how gluten free food is made in restaurants. Restaurants offering gluten free options should have to ensure those meals are made in controlled environments, so the food cannot be contaminated by gluten which would make it unsafe for coeliacs.
attributes.additional_details: Coeliac disease is a serious auto immune disease affecting 1 in 100 people in the UK. Upon minimal contact with gluten the immune system is triggered to attack the bowel lining, which can happen without any noticeable symptoms. By law foods labelled ‘gluten free’ must contain no more than 20 parts per million gluten, but if restaurants do not take care to prevent kitchen contamination gluten free meals are likely exceeding this safe level and triggering an immune reaction in coeliac sufferers.

attributes.action: Repeal the Spring Traps Approval (England) Order 2018
attributes.background: A number of traps for grey squirrels became approved in England from the 1st of January 2019 and are available for sale in the UK from that date. Killing Grey Squirrels is a cruel and unnecessary practice, I believe it is based on false information and propaganda.
attributes.additional_details: Killing one colour of squirrel in order to save another that might not able be able to thrive in most parts of today’s UK habitat regardless is a misinformed and completely misguided act. Remember, humans wiped out most red squirrels many years ago.

attributes.action: Utilise Reading Prison as a Shelter for the Homeless
attributes.background: Reading currently has the highest number of homeless not only in Berkshire but in the South East; as taxpayers we're already paying for this building to be heated, the lights kept on and the water running, it just makes sense when there are people, our people, outside in the cold, wind and rain.
attributes.additional_details:
Since 2013, Reading Prison which has a potential capacity to hold over 500 people, that has running water and still being heated, is just lying empty. 

So far it has cost the taxpayer in excess of a £1 Million to mothball. Unused for the last 5 years (save an art exhibition and the odd film production company using it for shooting locations), it seems to me almost criminal, when so many are in need of warmth and shelter to not utilise this for those of who find themselves homeless.

attributes.action: Counsellors on wards where 16 to 25-year-olds are receiving cancer treatment
attributes.background: Counsellors should be available for young people receiving cancer treatment. When I was diagnosed with cancer, it was a complete shock for me and my family. I found it harder to deal with mentally than the actual treatment itself.
attributes.additional_details: Despite being treated on a specialist adolescent unit for 16 to 25-year-olds, no counsellor is available for people in this age group. I and others would benefit from a counsellor being on wards and instantly available. The counsellor could then deal with any worries as they arise, and people would not need to wait for appointments in the community.

attributes.action: Slash Home Office settlement and naturalisation fees: stop making a huge profit
attributes.background: Home Office charges £2,389 for indefinite leave to remain (per person for the main applicant and every dependant) a rise of 25% on 2016-17. It costs £243 to process each application. The settlement visa for an adult dependent has risen from £585 in 2008-09 to £3,250 in 2017-18, an increase of 450%.
attributes.additional_details:
Fees for immigration and nationality applications have steadily risen since 2010 including in the latest round of changes in April. 
Figures released to the BBC showed the Home Office made £800m in revenue from fees in six years. 
The Home Office made profits of up to 800% on some immigration applications from families. 
References : https://www.theguardian.com/uk-news/2018/jun/24/reduce-home-office-fees-say-mps-campaigners

attributes.action: Make education about littering and its effects compulsary in all schools.
attributes.background: My name is Osian,  I am 17 and have Autism and anxiety.  I have volunteered in the Peak District for 4 years. The peace of the moors has saved my life and I want to do all I can to protect them.   The epidemic of littering and fly tipping is ruining the countryside and is a danger to wildlife.
attributes.additional_details: I am the National Trust Youth Volunteer for 2018 and want to use my award to promote my campaign. I believe that the only way to make a real difference with litter is to start with children.  I hope that they will grow up and teach people around them to also not drop litter. What we learn as a child we never forget.  I want every child to participate in an education programme that will result in a Certificate from the Government and sign a promise to not drop litter and look after their world.

attributes.action: STOP Emergency Services Suicides. Provide dedicated care.
attributes.background: Too many Emergency Services workers take their own lives, and are wrongly treated by their employers. Sacked, disciplined or made example of when all they need is help, treatment, care and understanding from their employers. There is no consistency, no understanding and very little care for people
attributes.additional_details: THIS MUST CHANGE before yet another employee takes their own life because of their treatment by their employers.

attributes.action: Make Zoroastrianism a part of the national curriculum
attributes.background: Schools should teach pupils about Zoroastrianism. It is one of the world's oldest active religions. It is the first monotheistic faith centered in a cosmology of good and evil and an eschatology predicting the ultimate destruction of evil. Ascribed by Zarathustra who lived almost 3,500 years ago.
attributes.additional_details: Zoroastrianism enters recorded history in the 5th-century BCE. It served as the state religion of the pre-Islamic Iranian empires for more than a millennium, from around 600 BCE to 650 CE.  Zoroastrianism was suppressed from the 7th century onwards following the Muslim conquest of Persia of 633–654. In 2015, there were reports of up to 100,000 converts in Iraqi Kurdistan. Zoroastrianism has influenced the Second Temple Judaism, Gnosticism, Christianity, Islam, and Buddhism.

attributes.action: Reduce the council tax for people who live in park homes
attributes.background: Other than refuse collections, park owners pay through their ground rents for their own lighting, roadworks, street cleaning, drainage and other services.  Many Councils also receive license fees from site owners that are also paid for by the occupiers

attributes.action: Make advertising for paid lifts illegal unless it's through a licensed operator.
attributes.background: Illegal paid 'lifts' are being offered on social media. Groups have been set up on FB offering 'lifts that are cheaper than a taxi'. Legitimate private/public hire drivers are DBS checked. Their cars are tested to make sure they are roadworthy. These are in place to protect members of the public.
attributes.additional_details: Legally, if being paid to transport someone via a motor vehicle, hire and reward insurance must be in place. This is only available to licensed drivers who hold a badge issued by their local authority. Unlicensed 'paid lifts' aren't insured. This puts the public at risk & the general response from the police &/or LA is that there is nothing they can do. It is only a matter of time before someone is seriously hurt in an accident or attacked. Those advertising unlicensed lifts should be prosecuted

attributes.action: Public inquiry into child support and maintenance
attributes.background: It’s time to now press for an independent inquiry and full investigation into CSA/CMS. Its every parent’s nightmare, dealing with the CSA/CMS . Making parents stressed , financially poor and worse not being able to see their children because they have no money too.
attributes.additional_details:
This department needs a fully public, independent investigation into how child maintenance has been run, everything made public knowledge. 

If you agree then sign this petition to make the government have to take action !!

attributes.action: Give Government time to debate Lord Berkeley's Bill on Female Genital Mutilation
attributes.background: This bill seeks to make a one-line amendment to the Children Act 1989, that would “considerably extend protection to young girls at greatest risk of genital mutilation.

attributes.action: Make employment businesses that supply electrical workers require a licence.
attributes.background:
Employment businesses/agencies that supply labour within the electrical trade are notorious with breaking the rules.

One of the most common problems is workers not being paid or having deductions made from there wages, both of which are illegal practices!
attributes.additional_details:
The EWB Propose a licensing system similar to the GLAA (http://www.gla.gov.uk/) to help protect the workers from these unfair practices.


The law is very clear on what an employment business/agency can and can't do but as it stands it is difficult to bring them to justice.

With a licence in place it makes the jobs of unions such as the IWGB:EWB easier to fight for fairness for workers.

Its time for change within the electrical industry and these unfair practices that break the law to change.

attributes.action: Ban the incubating and hatching of chicks in school classrooms
attributes.background: Unhatched chicks are taken from their their mothers, and brought into school classrooms where they are denied everything that is natural to them. Chicks born in this manner often become sick and deformed. Many projects like this result in the chicks being euthanised when it is over.
attributes.additional_details:
This practice is cruel and vastly outdated in many ways. 
There is nothing educational about animals, the environment or life cycles that can be found from practicing such 'projects' or 'experiments'. 

Chickens have complex social bonds and 'pecking orders'. These types of 'projects' deny them a chance to develop their natural bonds and deprive them of natural beginnings, hence negating the natural observation of animals and respect for their lives.

attributes.action: Redistribute 30 hours childcare funding to subsidise costs for children aged 1-4
attributes.background:
The current childcare funding is not available until a child is three years old. Consequently, there is a funding gap between the end of maternity leave and the start of the 30 hours funding. 

I propose we redistribute the funding to provide 15 hours childcare per week for children aged 1 to 4.
attributes.additional_details:
All parents are eligible for 15 hours funding for children aged 3 and 4. 

Families where both parents are working are eligible for an additional 15 hours funding for children aged 3 and 4. 

The current gap in childcare funding for children aged 1 and 2, means that childcare costs are one of the greatest barriers for parents returning to work. 

I propose we redistribute this entitlement so that families where both parents are working are eligible for the funding for children aged 1 and 2.

attributes.action: Drop the EU Withdrawal Agreement on the basis that it is unconstitutional.
attributes.background: The EU Withdrawal Agreement (EUWA) stipulates that we will have no representation in the EU Parliament while mandating we still pay VAT at rates limited by the EU. This means British citizens will be taxed without representation which is unconstitutional and may set a "taxes for deals" precedent.
attributes.additional_details: VAT was introduced on joining the EEC. It replaced the similar Purchase tax to avoid double taxation. VAT is therefore an EU mandated tax, irrespective of whether the EU is the main beneficiary or because it's collected by HMRC. The EU control the rate for competition reasons between member states and will retain ultimate jurisdiction in the UK over it. This is not a petition to "get rid of" VAT, but against the ramifications and precedents the EUWA may have on our fundamental rights

attributes.action: Quadruple the Manchester Piccadilly - Manchester Oxford Road Rail Corridor
attributes.background: In 2009, as part of the Northern Hub project, the Manchester Piccadilly - Manchester Oxford Road Rail Corridor was set to be quadrupled, with two new platforms (15/16) built at Manchester Piccadilly, yet this project has now been "postponed" indefinitely.
attributes.additional_details:
In 2018, the number of trains through the existing corridor (through platforms 13/14) was increased, despite the lack of available capacity, causing constant disruption. Despite this, Transport Secretary Chris Grayling has "postponed" the project indefinitely.

The rail passengers of Manchester and the North deserve better. These new platforms are urgently needed, as the current situation is unacceptable.

attributes.action: stop all eu low skilled migrants from entering the uk after we leave the eu
attributes.background:
It has become apparent that following the Home Office White Paper that eu  low skilled immigrants will still be allowed to enter the UK after Brexit. This is not taking back control of borders and is not respecting the Referendum result or the Tory Manifesto.

This petition was rej

attributes.action: Make recycling free for all schools in England.
attributes.background: Currently, schools are expected to pay in order for the council to take away their recyclable waste. I propose that all schools in England are given free recycling and that it is made mandatory that they should dispose of all of their waste in the most environmentally conscious way possible.
attributes.additional_details: I am the leader of my school's eco-club and I have been campaigning for there to be facilities where we can recycle our plastic waste for the past two years. Due to a tight budget and the council's insistence that we pay for them to dispose of our recycling we have been unable to get such facilities.

attributes.action: Make Keeping Dogs & Domestic Animals on Allotments Sites a Criminal Offence.
attributes.background:
Dogs & Domestic Animals are bred & kept alone on allotments in conditions in contravention of the 5 Freedoms of the Animal Welfare Act.
Animals, only discovered by chance among inaccessible enclaves of dilapidated sheds, often dead or dying;unsupervised, they are vulnerable to fire & random attack.
attributes.additional_details:
http://politicalanimal.org.uk/wp-content/uploads/2014/11/Welfare-of-animals-on-allotments.pdf
 .. Animals must not be kept on allotments, or anywhere else, unless their welfare needs can be provided for (as set out in the Animal Welfare Act 2006)
https://www.thenorthernecho.co.uk/news/15522360.greyhounds-were-kept-in-ramshackle-conditions-on-an-allotment https://www.gazettelive.co.uk/news/teesside-news/man-claims-animals-seized-lazenby-9527688

attributes.action: Open Family Courts up to public scrutiny
attributes.background: Family Court proceedings are not transparent. They are conducted away from public scrutiny. As a result there is little public awareness of the injustice many families experience and little accountability for poor judicial decisions. Anyone should be able to attend a Family Court hearing.
attributes.additional_details: The public interest lies in understanding how the law is being dispensed with regards to children and their parents. It lies in understanding the impacts these decisions have on our society. Hundreds of thousands of cases a year pass through the Family Courts unchecked with victims having no redress outside of cost prohibitive appeals to the Royal Courts of Justice. Public scrutiny of the system is required to ensure the process is efficient and protects the rights of both children and parents.

attributes.action: Enable an Emotional Support Animal to be recognised as an Assistance Dog.
attributes.background: In America service dogs cover both physical and mental health needs. Anxiety is a mental health condition that can cripple the people who suffer from it many of whom struggle to go outside let alone have a life that is equal to non-sufferers. Same goes for depression. So why can they not have help.
attributes.additional_details: The definition given by the government website for disability is to have a physical or mental impairment that has a substantial/long-term negative effect on ability to do normal daily activities. Anxiety, depression and other mental health illnesses fall under this and yet service dogs are not allowed. Dogs are important for people with mental health and allowing them to go everywhere with the person, like a guide dog, such as shops and restaurants allows the person to become a more active member of society.

attributes.action: The Commons should have the chance on or before 12 March to revoke Article 50
attributes.background: If 12 March is really the ‘moment of truth’ for Brexit, then MPs must be given the option of voting to revoke Article 50 and remain in the EU. Now is the time for MPs to lead.

attributes.action: We call on the Government to abandon the HS2 Rail project.
attributes.background: With the projected cost of HS2 rising towards £100bn, it would be better to stop the project now and use the money saved to provide free solar panels to the whole of the country.
attributes.additional_details: The former Chairman of Eurostar, Adam Mills, wrote that the claimed social and economic benefits of HS@ were "away with the fairies". He added, it would be far wiser to spend the money on traditional  rail enhancements given the relatively short distances between UK cities. In economic terms HS@ is unjustifiable. Existing trains  between London and Birmingham are underused at present and saving business men 30 minutes of travelling time does not justify the destruction of 1740 buildings including 888 homes, together with 60 irreplaceable ancient woodlands being destroyed.

attributes.action: NHS Allocation of Funds for PFO Closure in Selected Ischaemic Stroke Patients
attributes.background: Young and unsuspecting people suffer from stroke due to a hole in their heart called a PFO. There is a straight forward procedure scientifically proven to be statistically significant in reducing secondary stroke in these patients. The NHS does not currently allocate funding for this procedure.
attributes.additional_details:
Here are some links to relevant research: 

http://www.onlinejacc.org/content/69/11_Supplement/1260

http://www.onlinejacc.org/content/56/13_Supplement/B108.3

Professional boxer Dan Sarkozi is an example of an unsuspecting victim of cryptogenic stroke. Dan suffered a cryptogenic stroke due to a hole in his heart which was originally believed to be a PFO. He faced the proposition of losing his career and spending his life on blood thinning medication due to lack of funding for this procedure.

attributes.action: Require airlines to carry small pets in aircraft cabin on flights to the UK
attributes.background:
Ever tried going on holiday with your best friend? 
Unfortunately for pet owners that live in the UK the options are limited: 1. leave your dog in a kennel (If family/friends is not an option) 2. take your pet with you and return via ferry or car 3. ship your pet as cargo in the hold.
attributes.additional_details:
Putting a pet in cargo (if your pet is not snub nosed like mine) is very risky and traumatic, especially for long flights. For those with pets that comply with cabin regulations, it is simply unnecessary to either not be able to fly into Britain or have to leave a pet behind for an extended period of time. 
Why are we able to fly out with pets in cabin and not back into the UK? 
The British are among the biggest animal-lovers in the world. Let's make it easier to enjoy family holidays together!

attributes.action: Longer sentences for dangerous driving!
attributes.background: Our dad was killed in a hit and run accident on 29th Oct 2018. Dad was a proud father, loving husband and caring grandfather. We will miss dad everyday and our lives have  changed forever.  People drive dangerously without thinking how this will effect somebody's life. Photos & memories all we have.
attributes.additional_details:
We need tougher sentencing to ensure that people's lives are not taken away by such irresponsible actions.  We the victim's family have to live with this for the rest of our lives.  But the culprits will end up in prison for such a short time, usually only completing half their sentence.   

The culprits will then be allowed to move forward with their lives once they have been released.  They will be able to rehabilitate themselves into society.  But what about the victim's family?

attributes.action: Review animal cruelty laws to include lifetime ban and a prison sentence
attributes.background: A lifetime ban on animal/pet ownership should be introduced for severe cases of animal cruelty. Also, for severe cases of cruelty, longer prison sentences should be considered. The current laws should be harsher to deter owners of animals being cruel to their pets.
attributes.additional_details:
A very distressing case of a woman letting a horse starve, which eventually had to be put down, is just one of the latest examples. 
"starved her horse to the point of collapse which led to her eventual death". This story was highlighted on derbytelegraph.co.uk.

attributes.action: All babies to have a pulse oximetry test as part of a newborn screening
attributes.background: All baby’s deserve the right for a routine pulse oximetry test as part of newborn screening before leaving hospital to identify any undiagnosed heart conditions & defects. Around 1,000 babies are sent home each year with an undiagnosed heart condition, putting each baby’s heart at risk.

attributes.action: Give Mandatory Custodial Sentences for anyone desecrating a War Memorial
attributes.background: The desecration of war memorials is both sickening and disrespectful to the fine brave men and women who gave their lives to ensure democracy to this country and the free world. It should be punished with a custodial sentence.

attributes.action: Pay all government in-house & outsourced staff the real living wage
attributes.background:
Thousands of employees working for the government earn under the real living wage - currently £10.55 p/hour in London & £9.00 p/hour outside of London.

All workers deserve at least the living wage & the government should be leading by example ensuring that in-house & outsourced staff receive it.
attributes.additional_details: Currently nearly 3,000 workers at the Ministry of Justice (MoJ) earn below the real living wage, as do hundreds of workers who are outsourced at the MoJ such as security guards, cleaners and receptionists. They are now taking strike action through their union United Voices of the World (UVW), as are outsourced staff through PCS Union at the Department of Business, Energy and Industrial Strategy (BEIS) simply because the government won't listen and refuses to pay them a wage they can live off.

attributes.action: Free prescriptions for transplant recipients
attributes.background: Transplant patients are on immune suppressants and anti-rejection medication for the rest of their life. As with a lot of other illnesses, they shouldn't have to pay for them.
